skill.name: perplexity-search
skill.description: Perform AI-powered web searches with real-time information using Perplexity models via LiteLLM and OpenRouter. This skill should be used when conducting web searches for current information, finding recent scientific literature, getting grounded answers with source citations, or accessing information beyond the model's knowledge cutoff. Provides access to multiple Perplexity models including Sonar Pro, Sonar Pro Search (advanced agentic search), and Sonar Reasoning Pro through a single OpenRouter API key.

security_audit.summary: This skill provides web search functionality through Perplexity API. It reads an API key from environment variables, makes network requests to OpenRouter, and writes user-specified output files. All capabilities align with the stated purpose of performing web searches. No credential theft, data exfiltration, or suspicious network behavior detected.

content.user_title: Search the web with Perplexity AI
content.value_statement: Finding current information and recent research requires manual browsing and citation tracking. This skill enables AI-powered web searches with real-time results and automatic source citations through Perplexity models accessed via OpenRouter.
actual_capabilities: Perform web searches using Perplexity AI models (Sonar, Sonar Pro, Sonar Pro Search, Sonar Reasoning Pro)
Access real-time information beyond training data cutoff with source citations
Configure OpenRouter API key for unified access to multiple Perplexity models
Save search results to JSON files for research documentation
Use different models for different complexity levels (simple facts vs deep analysis)
Validate setup and monitor API usage through built-in check commands
limitations: Requires OpenRouter API key and credits for each search query
Does not provide direct browsing interface - returns text answers with citations
Cost varies by model selection (Sonar Pro Search is most expensive)
Relies on external OpenRouter service availability

use_cases.title: Find recent scientific literature
use_cases.description: Search for recent publications, clinical trials, and research findings with automatic source citations.

use_cases.title: Get current technical documentation
use_cases.description: Find up-to-date information on frameworks, tools, and technical implementations beyond training data.

use_cases.title: Verify facts with sources
use_cases.description: Research topics with grounded answers and cite authoritative sources for academic work.

prompt_templates.title: Simple search
prompt_templates.prompt: What is [topic]? Provide a brief explanation with key details.

prompt_templates.title: Research query
prompt_templates.prompt: What does recent research (2023-2024) say about [specific topic]? Focus on peer-reviewed studies and include specific findings.

prompt_templates.title: Comparative analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare [option A] versus [option B] for [use case] in terms of [criteria 1], [criteria 2], and [criteria 3].

prompt_templates.title: Deep research
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a comprehensive analysis of [complex topic]. Include current developments, limitations, open questions, and areas needing further research with specific sources.

output_examples.input: What are the latest developments in mRNA vaccine technology?
output: Self-amplifying mRNA vaccines showing improved durability in recent trials
Next-generation lipid nanoparticles reducing side effects
Current phase 2/3 trials for personalized cancer vaccines using mRNA platforms
Sources: Nature Biotechnology 2024, The Lancet Infectious Diseases

best_practices: Start with Sonar Pro as the default model for most queries
Use specific, detailed queries with time frames and domain constraints
Monitor OpenRouter usage and costs through the dashboard regularly
Set spending limits in OpenRouter to prevent unexpected charges
anti_patterns: Asking overly broad questions without specific topics or constraints
Using complex Sonar Pro Search for simple fact lookups (unnecessary cost)
Committing API keys to version control or sharing them publicly
Skipping source verification by not checking cited references

faq.question: What AI tools are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through their standard skill integration system.

faq.question: How many queries can I make?
faq.answer: Unlimited queries are possible. Cost depends on model selection and is billed through OpenRouter based on token usage.

faq.question: How does it integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Complements literature review, scientific writing, and hypothesis generation skills by providing current research findings.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Queries are sent to Perplexity via OpenRouter. API keys should never be shared. Review OpenRouter privacy policy for details.

faq.question: Why are my searches failing?
faq.answer:: Common causes: missing API key, insufficient credits, rate limits, or network issues. Run --check-setup to diagnose.

faq.question: How does this differ from other search skills?
faq.answer: Perplexity provides AI-generated answers with source citations rather than just returning links. Offers multiple model tiers for different needs.
